name: ðŸ‘µLalla's house
description: Legendary fabric dye artisan in the Fes medina. Three sons, but only Amir stayed. {D:B1,W:FRB,w:LW,P:CU,p:FB,mesh:3}

events.description: Lalla Dounia hums old Berber chants over the vats. The saffron dye boils over â€” a bad sign. She crushes rose petals harder than usual.
Amir says traffic. Dounia sees red threads tangled in his scarf â€” not theirs. She eyes him. He avoids it. The apprentices watch, wide-eyed.

events.summary: Layla's Secret Visit (Behind the Vat Room)
events.description: Layla sneaks in through the alley. She and Amir whisper behind the indigo vat. A spilled pomegranate dye marks the floor like blood. Dounia senses something. The cat hisses.
A group of Spanish tourists ask too many questions. One tries to stir the vat and gets dye on his shirt. Dounia smiles sweetly â€” but the vat boils higher.
Someone hangs new crimson cloth across the alley. It looksâ€¦ exactly like Douniaâ€™s recipe. She gasps. Betrayal or coincidence? Amir clenches his jaw.
Dounia reads henna patterns for a bride-to-be. The symbols twist strangely. 'Thereâ€™s a woman close to you... hiding a great truth,' she says. Layla walks past the window.
Dounia and Youssef lock eyes over baskets of dried hibiscus. He smirks. She drops her oranges. â€˜Weâ€™re not done,â€™ she says, picking them up slowly.
He tries to tell his mother everything. But Haj Youssef shows up unannounced, pretending to buy dyed silk. Tension thickens. Layla watches from the doorway, hand on stomach.
The dye vats overflow. Fabrics stain unpredictably. Dounia screams at the sky: 'Even the colours are lying to me now!' A bird lands on her shoulder. She takes it as a sign.
